title: Why do newspapers like to print the age of persons named in the paper?  Why is that relevant to a story?
text:
Of course age is relevant to many stories. It's part of description
of a person. In some stories, it's more relevant than others. 

For example, if someone graduates from college at age 21, it's not
unusual. But if they graduate at age 80, that's entirely different. 

For another example, age is relevant in all sorts of legal and
criminal matters, such as whether someone is tried as a juvenile or an
adult, or whether they are of legal drinking age, or able to sign a
contract on their own.

There are all sorts of other reasons age is relevant to stories as
well.
